item.title: Comment on Hello world! by A WordPress Commenter
item.dc:creator: A WordPress Commenter
item.description: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from <a href="https://en.gravatar.com/">Gravatar</a>.
item.content:encoded:
Hi, this is a comment.
To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard.
Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Comment on Traditional Primary Care by Harry Olson
item.dc:creator: Harry Olson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://creativekhichdi.github.io/community_first/portfolio/integrated-innovations/#comment-31">David Parker</a>.
Great tool! I am using a redirect plugin to send all my 404’s to my home page but I think it’s slacking sometimes.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to David Parker.

Great tool! I am using a redirect plugin to send all my 404’s to my home page but I think it’s slacking sometimes.

item.title: Comment on Traditional Primary Care by David Parker
item.dc:creator: David Parker
item.description: This is a useful post for finding broken links within the website, what about links pointing outwards that are broken? I can use a free web service but wondered if this was possible.
item.content:encoded: This is a useful post for finding broken links within the website, what about links pointing outwards that are broken? I can use a free web service but wondered if this was possible.
